summary:
@fortunatelylori replied to your post “im curious why did you switch arya and sansa around in your sun & moon...”
              ...
body:
@fortunatelylori replied to your post “im curious why did you switch arya and sansa around in your sun & moon…”

I’ve always thought of Sansa as the moon and Arya as the sun in Ned’s quote. I didn’t even think people imagined them the other way around.

Most people assume on the first read/first look that Sansa is the sun and Arya’s the moon. Sansa’s bright and vivacious — she’s described as radiant and she has traditional skills of a Lady. Arya’s wild and moody — she’s looks like she could be the moon to Sansa’s sun. That’s how the trope fits aesthetically; Sansa’s red hair and Arya’s brunette. And while both girls fit the sun and the moon attributes in their own way, so one can argue that it’s somewhat interchangeable, it’s more likely that Sansa’s the moon and Arya’s the sun, yes. It’s not the most obvious thing, I’ve noticed, since in a lot of the Stark Sisters edits, Sansa represents the sun and Arya the moon.

summary: Something else I was thinking about were the stone statues in the crypts. When Arya and Sansa reunite they meet in the crypts...
body:
Something else I was thinking about were the stone statues in the crypts. When Arya and Sansa reunite they meet in the crypts and talk about their fathers and how it should have been carved by someone who knew his face but everyone who knew his face was dead.

People keep theorizing that the statues of Sansa and Arya are young because they die young while Jon’s is old because well, he lives. However I disagree. I think Sansa purposefully had these built while they’re all alive because she wants them to be done by someone who knows them. I think Jon’s looks old because of the facial hair. It makes it harder to carve but it still looks like Jon. The statues are never that flattering.

But that’s just my thoughts.

summary: ❝You and I, we will meet again❞ It’s when Eddard sees Arya hold a sword that something breaks in him. Eddard cries a tear while...
body:
❝You and I, we will meet again❞

It’s when Eddard sees Arya hold a sword that something breaks in him. Eddard cries a tear while Lyanna seems to reborn inside of Arya.

The same night Eddard wakes up suddenly next to Catelyn. He knows he’ll never hear her voice again, he’ll never see her face again, he’ll never hear her laughter again.

He realizes that she’s still dead until the end of time, no matter how much Arya might resemble Lyanna.

——  Eddard & Lyanna + mention of Arya aesthetic |  © caption by me.

summary: Arya Stark is almost always afraid. But that’s the point of bravery isn’t it? It’s doing things even when you’re scared. It’s...
body: Arya Stark is almost always afraid. But that’s the point of bravery isn’t it? It’s doing things even when you’re scared. It’s standing up to those you fear most. It’s doing it all despite that fear writhing in your stomach, in your chest.

reblog.comment: Arya Stark is almost always afraid. But that’s the point of bravery isn’t it? It’s doing things even when you’re scared. It’s standing up to those you fear most. It’s doing it all despite that fear writhing in your stomach, in your chest.

trail.content_raw: Arya Stark is almost always afraid. But that’s the point of bravery isn’t it? It’s doing things even when you’re scared. It’s standing up to those you fear most. It’s doing it all despite that fear writhing in your stomach, in your chest.

tags: to the endgame of this story
summary:
If I see "Arya Stark" and "warrior" or "fighting skills" in the same sentence I inmedietly become suspicious.
My girl is a...
body:
If I see “Arya Stark” and “warrior” or “fighting skills” in the same sentence I inmedietly become suspicious.

My girl is a polyglot! She’s a skinchanger! She’s becoming a human lie detector. Knows her poisons and her knives. It is canon that she’s skillful at managing a house, good at math and at listening to other people AND becoming their friends, a total social butterfly! She’s trained to spy for secrets and differentiate between useful truths from useless lies, on top of blending in as easily as if she was changing clothes. My girl is s hardworker! She cleans and cooks dutifully. If a role demands she learn a skill she does it cause she’s plucky and determined like that. Her experience have taught her when to keep silent, when to speak, what to examine in others and what to use to her advantage, C U N N I N G. Her skillset and experiences are so ample that she’s literally the wild card for GRRM to drop whenever needed, if he wanted a swordfighter he’d already have Jon Snow or Brienne. My girl is connected to the Brotherhoow without Banners, being searched by Brienne, the North is marching on Winterfell and supporting Stannis in the name of rescuing her! Jon Snow sent Mance Rayder to Winterfell to get her back. She wargs into Nymeria who COMMANDS an entire PACK of wolves. Only two characters deeply appreciate the smallfolk (Arya and Dany) but Arya is the only one who has actually lived the Westerosi version of the smallfolk life in all its tragedy: cold, starvation, forced labor; her knowledge of how things work on the base level of society can be extremely useful in a future of rebuilding. The Old Gods taaaaalk to her!!!!!!

If I see “Arya Stark” and “warrior” or “fighting skills” in the same sentence I inmedietly become suspicious of OP…

tags: vikings x game of thrones crossover
to make the gods take notice
summary: To Make The Gods Take Notice 4
title: To Make The Gods Take Notice 4
body:
Send me an ask or a message if you want to be removed from or added to the tag list.

Tag list: @whenimaunicorn, @tiyetiye,  @romanchronicles, @umnoyeahno, @pebblesz892, @kenzieam, @kahliethefangirl, @oddsnendsfanfics, @belle-scarre, @captainpoopweinersoldier, @brightlycoloredteacups, @hvitserksgirl, @maggymoo96, @bluearchersstuff, @titty-teetee, @captstefanbrandt , @ivars-heathen, @oqueequesentes-borboletas

Ivar and Arya

Rating: Explicit

Warnings: Graphic depictions of violence, Blood and Gore, Blood and Violence, Implied/Referenced Torture, Suicidal Thoughts, Starvation, Poor living conditions, Reluctant allies, So much sass

Summary: Arya is an acolyte in the House of Black and White. Her mentor expects her to become no one but leaving her old life behind proves to be difficult. Upon arriving in Braavos, Ivar hears rumours of a temple where death is worshipped. Clearly, this must be the right place for him to go.

Words: 1575

CHAPTER WARNINGS: Referenced attempted assault, Graphic depictions of violence

Link to whole fic

Excerpt

He’s never been fond of the water, but now watching the ships as they come and go is the only reminder of home. There’s a shield leaning against the crates and the decoration does manage to put a smile on his face: a longship, against a background of red and orange. One of the boys stumbles as he attempts to lift a crate. The only thing keeping him on dry land is the swift reaction of an older man.

“Glyndwer!” The older man bellows with his fist around the boy’s arm “Watch your step.”

Finish on AO3

tags: mere and i were talking about this just yesterday‚ i have a lot of feelings about the stark sisters even if i can’t articulate them well
summary: im curious why did you switch arya and sansa around in your sun & moon edit?
question: im curious why did you switch arya and sansa around in your sun & moon edit?
answer:
Hi! This is a great question…because imo I didn’t really switch them around.

Thing about the Stark Sisters is that they are two sides of the same coin, irrefutably connected through their blood. Even as they act as each other’s foils, their skills and personalities compliment one another. It’s really beautiful.

When reviewing Ned’s quote “You may be as different as the sun and the moon, but the same blood flows through both your hearts. You need her, as she needs you.” one can conclude, at least superficially, that Sansa is the sun and Arya is the moon: Sansa is bright, vivacious, and charming, she has the vibrant Tully colouring. Arya is wild, temperamental, intuitive, and has a dark, Stark look.

However, upon closer examination of their personalities and of aspects associated with the sun and with the moon, it becomes apparent that it’s the other way around. The qualities I picked for Sansa and Arya in the edit, in my opinion, are those that reflect them best.

  • Sansa as 🌙: secretive, perceptive, complex, romantic, subtle, sensitive, adaptable.
  • Arya as 🌞: passionate, daring, impulsive, friendly, physical, assertive, rebellious.

Just like with the Ned&Cat parallels between the Stark Sisters — how Sansa looks like Catelyn, but is closer to Ned’s quieter personality; and how Arya looks like Ned, but has Catelyn’s strong nature — the sun&moon imagery appears as one thing outwardly and is reversed inwardly.

tags: i prefer sansa as the moon and arya as the sun
but honestly i see arguments for either way
as different as the sun and moon
summary: Anyways
body:
Anyways

It’s interesting to me that the “as different as the sun and moon” quote for Sansa and Arya is so prevailing, but not everyone agrees on which sister is the sun or the moon.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Unpopular opinion, but I’m not sure that book!Arya fights in the Battle for the Dawn. She’ll play a part, but i dont really see...
body:
Unpopular opinion, but I’m not sure that book!Arya fights in the Battle for the Dawn. She’ll play a part, but i dont really see her as an active combatant in the battle. She does not have the fighting skills for that form of fighting. She can use Needle, but most of the time she has the key element of surprise. She has never had to go sword to sword before in actual fighting. The closest we get to it is Syrio and she talks more about chasing cats than actual fighting. We also get the scenes where Arya is the Blind Girl and is practicing with staffs, but she again has a secret weapon there. Its implied she can warg into cats (fun parallel there), allowing her to see her assailant and throw them off. 

“The priest winced and snatched his hand back. “And how could a blind girl know that?” I saw you. “I gave you three. I don’t need to give you four.” Maybe on the morrow she would tell him about the cat that had followed her home last night from Pynto’s, the cat that was hiding in the rafters, looking down on them. Or maybe not. If he could have secrets, so could she.” - The Blind Girl, ADwD

A lot of the wins Arya gets is not based on skill, its based on strategy and surprise. She kills Raff the Sweetling because she distracts him. She kills the Stable Boy because he does not expect it. When she kills the insurance salesman he does not expect it and she uses a small blade. She manages to take down Dareon because, once again, she surprises him and slits his throat. Dareon spent so much time at pubs and brothels there is always the chance he was drunk as well. Arya’s kills have less to do with a sword and more to do with being clever. 

“But, she-wolf, she is at the HoBaW! She’s getting fighting skills!” 

Is she? 

So far, not really. Or at least not the type that would work against White Walkers. She can use a small blade, she can get information, and she can use poison. None of that works in a battle. Could you even poison White Walkers? On top of that why would the HoBaW teach a trainee (she has not drank from the cup o’ doom yet) battle tactics? Battle does not seem the best way to assassinate a person. 

I’m not sure what role Arya will play. I’m sure she will have one and it will play to her strengths but she has little to no training in actual battle style-combat.

blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: I should also tag it as
summary: What do you think about the sansa x edric dayne crackship (I doubt it will happen and I think narratively sansan will happen). ...
question: What do you think about the sansa x edric dayne crackship (I doubt it will happen and I think narratively sansan will happen).  It will still mean that bran rules the north, arya and edric get along pretty well, there will be a stark in the north and south, and we can ship sansa with lemoncakes and happiness.  Also can you imagine Gendry's reaction considering his jealousy and now he would be brothers with Edric.  LOL (My main reason for shipping it is because of Gendry's reaction).
answer:
I don’t think there is any canon foundation to this ship, but then again that’s the fun of crack shipping. So if you like that pairing it’s great :)

I like little Ned Deyne, he seems a sweet child. But the only character I can ship him with (romantically or platonic) is Arya. He seemed quite taken with her when he met her back in A Storm of Swords and I found his crush pretty cute (and it was funny to see Gendry’s reaction to this because Gendya is my main ship xD).

I like your future scenario though, where Bran rules the North, Arya and Gendry are together and Sansa is happy and has lots of lemon cakes. And I believe she deserves to be shipped with a good guy around her age. But for me the said guy is Podrick. After all, the boy had a HUGE crush on Lady Sansa in the books and in the tv series his spending his time protecting her (alongside with Brienne). Their curcumstances of their meeting and their current position makes the premise for an interesting love story, don’t you think? I know Podrick x Sansa is a small ship but deserves more love and recognition <3

Anyway, all crack ships are valid and as long as we know that they probably won’t happen we won’t get disappointed one day. And meanwhile, we can always create our own headcanons where our favourite crack ships happen :)

blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: a post of ice and fire
summary: Arya is just a precious bean. She’s not here for Westeros’ classism. She judges people not based on their society’s  status but...
body:
Arya is just a precious bean.

She’s not here for Westeros’ classism. She judges people not based on their society’s  status but based on their actual character. And in a society such as Westeros where classism is deep rooted and celebrated that’s important.

reblog.comment:

She’s not here for Westeros’ classism. She judges people not based on their society’s  status but based on their actual character. And in a society such as Westeros where classism is deep rooted and celebrated that’s important.

trail.content_raw:
Arya is just a precious bean.

She’s not here for Westeros’ classism. She judges people not based on their society’s  status but based on their actual character. And in a society such as Westeros where classism is deep rooted and celebrated that’s important.
